content: I created few machine learning models to predict future days of Coronavirus cases, deaths and infected. Dataset is scraped from `worldometers.info` website. Generated 90-Days prediction charts are published at new website (https://covid19-90days-prediction-charts.netlify.app/).

I made a pandemic disease tracker for COVID-19 running in Linux Terminal. It so blazing fast fetching data than normal websites such as `worldometers.info`. It uses pre-existing data API from (https://github.com/novelcovid/api).

Been 7 years since I built `Lyft`, a tool for migrating settings and data from one Linux installation to another since the year 2012. It can be used while re-installing the operating system, and when moving to the next release of a Linux distribution. Used by many corporate companies and data centers
Added new page to `FX-Gradient Previewer` page, visually explaning how gradient overlaying with background image look like.
Officially and announcing `Yogurt CSS` v1.0.2 stable release. Prototype has ended, finally!
Spending two hours making an `FX-Gradient` web page with Krugurt.js and Yogurt.css
Spending two hours making an `FX-Gradient` web page with Krugurt.js and Yogurt.css

Finished up a dirty draft to create an `Adaptive Image Loader` for WebP image format. The func checks the minimum threshold of the DownLink speed and the Round-Trip Time then load different quality of WebP or non-WebP images or both WebPs.

I always want to create a view library that I love to use and have a minimal learning curve to kickstart a project quickly. In `Krunch.js` no new syntax to learn, very few template directives, very fewer proprietaries stuff, no magic or smart reactive properties or hooks, `explicit` behaviors over `implicit` assumptions. Easy to create a web component API, every HTML is a Javascript function with added callbacks and methods, and so on.

Proof of concept to change text color contrast against background image average color with machine learning on web browser with `kurgurt.js` without using SCSS/SASS HSL. Just 4kb of architecture-free neural network that running Sigmoid activation function.

Give a performance test to project `Krugurt`. The `compiler` speed is important, it mounting the HTML components and turns them into JavaScript Functions with Parameters and Callbacks before rendering them in virtual-DOM.

(WIP) New localization module for Project `Krugurt`, initial features are detecting the user language, load the translations, and cache the translations. Support plurals, context, interpolation and format.
If you prefer not a graphical way, I've made a Terminal-based resume that simply type the command `$ npx loouislow-resume` in your operating system Terminal either Linux or Mac.

(WIP) New testing and playground tool for Yogurt UI toolkit has released. Platform binary will be releases on the next day for Linux, Mac and Windows. You can even export the test code for production use.
